item.title: Kelly add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Those unable to catalog the past are doomed to repeat it." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Cucumbers are technically a fruit and in the same family as pumpkins, melons and squash, so it may benefit those markets, although, to be honest, giant melons don't strike me as potentially that commercial." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "Sipping once, sipping twice, sipping chicken soup with rice." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "Is it sad to fancy David Tennant when you're dead?" -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "To love another person is to see the face of God." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Anne Rockwell
item.description: "Big wheels work for us." -- Anne Rockwell

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Lauren Groff
item.description: "Freedom or community, community or freedom. One must decide the way one wants to live. I chose community." -- Lauren Groff

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Lauren Groff
item.description: "He can only bear tragedy if it's abstract." -- Lauren Groff

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Marie Rutkoski
item.description: "Just because you don't know something doesn't mean it's not true." -- Marie Rutkoski

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Marie Rutkoski
item.description: "If you would like to know how easy it is to overlook evil, Petra could tell you: it is the easiest thing in the world." -- Marie Rutkoski

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Marie Rutkoski
item.description: "It's easier to break something than create it." -- Marie Rutkoski

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Marie Rutkoski
item.description: "Oranges were the prince's favorite fruit. He always peeled tem himself, and took some pleasure in tearing the bright skin away to expose the soft wedges within. He liked the spray of tiny citrus beads, he liked the tangy taste, and above all he liked that an orange is a fruit to be eaten piece by piece." -- Marie Rutkoski

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Octavia E. Butler
item.description: "In my years, I have seen that people must be their own gods and make their own good fortune. The bad will come or not come anyway." -- Octavia E. Butler

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Octavia E. Butler
item.description: "Civilization is the way one's own people live. Savagery is the way foreigners live." -- Octavia E. Butler
